title: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 incorrect behavior with custom cookie name affecting URL rewriting
description: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 incorrectly states that a custom cookie name affects URL rewriting.
OB: In chapter 7.1.1 of the servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is mentioned that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will be used as the name of the URI parameter when the session ID is encoded in the URL (assuming URL rewriting is enabled). However, the actual behavior observed is that the page sends a cookie with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE' and the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid' instead.
EB: The expected behavior is that if a custom name is configured for session tracking cookies, the Reload link should include the custom cookie name in the URL as follows: http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Enable URL rewriting in the web application.
2. Configure a custom name for the session tracking cookies.
3. Access the web application and observe the cookies being set.
4. Click on the Reload link on the page and observe the URL generated.
